Posts.Content: Hi Grogg Thank you for your reply and for making me smile, my husband is trying so hard for me. I see the oncologist on 13th November. It seems such a long way off. I feel like I am losing my mind. I am so scared he will say it has spread and that its untreatable. I thought I would grow old with mu husband and children and now I cannot see a future with me in it.  My children are taking exams soon and I worry that this will affect that badly too. Although must say they are being braver than me. I am being such a weed.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: My son is in second year of uni. His first response was that there is so much they can do now. I think he is blocking it out and getting on with things. My daughter is being so strong too, she has GCSEs next year and I am so worried that this will hamper her.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, sounds like we were diagnosed around the same time. I have to have chemo before they will take mine out. Psychologically it would be good to get rid of it first, but that's not their plan. Hope your surgery goes well. Let us know how you get on.  Take care of you too xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Oh I am glad the friend request was ok. You are so kind and honest. It's comforting to hear that a person so similar to my former self has behaved in a similar way. Not that I want for you, me or anyone else to feel this way - you know what I mean. I have had the scans, waiting to see the oncologist for results.  I know what your hubby means, I just want to be me again.  Just waiting while this thing is in me is horrible. Xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi mirabo I am overwhelmed by the amount of compassionate messages I have been sent.  There is so much to understand with all the terms of treatments etc. I am so pleased for you that you are doing so well. X
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Sara08 I know exactly what you mean, it is on your mind the whole time. After a lot of waiting to get seen, getting to see a doctor for a referral to breast clinic mainly, I was diagnosed on 1 November. Still waiting to see oncologist for scan results and treatment plan.  Everyone  says that it gets better once you are on the treatment road. Let's hope so. Wishing you well.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi optimistic I am going to phone my doctor about changing my tablets, I need something but not those. I have pet scan next week. Hopefully all will be well. Yep stay strong, but we are allowed a few wobbles too. X
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi AnnaK Hope your chemo went ok today. Xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Thank you for your reply. I am new to online chatting so I am a bit awkward at the moment. It was nice to get a reply, so I know I got that bit right anyway. The constant fear is so difficult to live with isn't it. I am trying to separate my life and my fear. Hubby says it will probably get easier once I start treatment. I feel so helpless at the moment.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello annak Thank you for your kind message. Yes I have spoken to the doctor and he has suggested some homeopathic things. I prefer these to drugs and will give them a go.  Xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello Thank you for talking to me. We do sound very similar. My husband and children are so important to me. I know I have to get a handle on this. I am not eating, sleeping, can't seem to think about anything else. This is only going to make it worse, I know, but I can't yet find a way through it to live as near normal as possible.  We have sixth form open evenings to attend all this week, but I don't think I can go. I can't really sit there shaking and crying, but I feel so bad leaving them to deal with it alone. They are obviously upset and worried too and I am causing them even more worry. If only they would get on with my treatment, at least then I will feel I am fighting back. It's good to hear yours had not spread and I hope your scan goes well. Sounds like you have a strong hubby.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you. I will probably mess up a few times, but I will still keep trying.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed just over a week ago. Have had scans to see if it has spread and am so scared. Cannot sleep, eat and shaking all the time. So worried for my husband and children too.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you for your post Optimistic. I am really struggling to use this on line thing and I think I may have accidentally refused your friend request. Is it possible to do it again. I did not mean to reject it. I can't get the hang of this and only find my messages by clicking around practically everything and find it by chance - doh! Your post was lovely to read. I too have been to all my children's things and last night I just could not be with all those people packed into a school hall. Imagine if I had had a panic attack then. I went to the doctor yesterday and she has given me sleeping tablets and diazepam. I can't believe I have sunk this low. It feels like I have some horrible alien inside me and I can't get it out. It feels like I am never going to be me and capable again. Have become very dependant on my husband to do meals, shopping etc and that's just not me. I hate it when he goes to work and I feel so vulnerable. I am so sorry, you are being encouraging and I am being so wet. I really do wish you well.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Ronstar Thank you for your post. Lots of useful info there. I am not a techno head and am struggling with the forum a bit. I think I have just refused a friend request by accident. Feel really bad.  It amazes me how everyone can be so positive and encouraging when they are going through it too. Hopefully I will become brave again too.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi  I don't know how to just write something, not as a reply to something. So it looks like I am replying, but this is a new development. Nurse phoned me late yesterday to say they have moved my oncology appointment to this morning. So I find out today whether or not it has spread and whatever else they tell you then. I am very mixed about this. Finally, I will find out, but part of me wants to run and hide away in case things are even worse. And the weather is miserable, the shower packed up last night, my daughter thinks she may have done badly in an exam yesterday and she did not feel well either - aaaggghh! Could not deal with shower as we had to go to a school open evening. Have we not got enough to deal with.
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Saw the oncologist. Finally got some answers, but questions too. It seems the cancer has not spread. However the ct scan picked up something on my lung. It may be benign, but more tests required. They are going ahead with organising my chemo programme though. But can't start until lung results are done. So, something new to worry about. Don't think I will continue with tabs from doctor. Feel really groggy in the morning. All the side effects of chemo sound really horrible. Hugs to all x
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi annak Yes it's not good to be stuck again in the not knowing and worrying phase.  And isn't absolutely pants that when you are struggling with this, loads of other things start going wrong too. You feel you just can't take anymore. I hope your chemo goes okay. Your 2 steps to coping sound like a good plan. We know it's not going to be easy but what choice do we have.  You are on the road to getting better. Good luck. X
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with breast cancer
